intro: Psychotria eminiana var. tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender-leafed psychotria, is a species native to parts of South America, particularly Ecuador. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, known for its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, such as montane forests. Its botanical features include a woody stem, opposite leaf arrangement, and small, elliptical leaves with a smooth surface.
